snippet: Many of us can't readily digest milk. In my case, it seemed to lead to chronic heartburn.
abstract: Many of us can't readily digest milk. In my case, it seemed to lead to chronic heartburn.

headline.main: Got Milk? You Don't Need It

snippet: At a Fisher-Price lab, researchers watch children at play to come up with ideas for new products, including toys that incorporate apps on iPads and iPhones.
abstract: Nicole LaPorte Prototype column on researchers at a Fisher-Price lab in East Aurora, NY, who watch children at play in order to develop ideas for new products, including toys that incorporate apps on iPads and iPhones.

snippet: The surge in Apple’s stock has made it a huge component in many mutual funds, leaving managers to wonder whether to hang on for more gains, or to prepare for possible declines.
abstract: Surge in Apple’s stock has made it a huge component in many mutual funds, leaving managers to wonder whether to hang on for more gains, or to prepare for possible declines; many analysts see Apple continuing its ascent, though it is not immune to profit margin pressure.

headline.main: Apple Is the Heavyweight in Many Fund Portfolios
headline.print_headline: Apple Is the Heavyweight in Many Portfolios

snippet: From the Kinetoscope to the big screen to the cellphone, movie-watching has come almost full circle.
abstract: Randall Stross Digital Domain column observes that from the Kinetoscope to the big screen to the laptop, tablet and cellphone, movie-watching over the past century has come almost full circle to a solitary experience; notes IHS Screen Digest estimates Americans will pay to watch 3.4 billion movies online in 2012, much more than double the number for 2010; says it is impossible to determine exactly how many of those movies will be viewed, and on which portable devices.

headline.main: Yes, Norma Desmond, the Pictures Are Getting Small Again
headline.print_headline: Yes, Norma Desmond, The Pictures Are Getting Small Again

snippet: Around a national park in Wales, a cottage industry has sprouted, guiding the adventurous to wild food. “In summer, it’s a free salad bar outside,” says one forager.
abstract: Cottage industry guiding the adventurous to edible greens, nuts and berries in the wild is emerging in the countryside of Wales, in the area around Brecon Beacons National Park.

headline.main: Foraging in the Wilds of Wales
headline.print_headline: Foraging in the Wilds of Wales

snippet: The author of “Bitterblue,” the third in the young adult Graceling Realm trilogy, says there’s no difference between Y.A. and grown-up literature. “A great book is a great book.”
abstract: By the Book interview with Kristin Cashore, author of Bitterblue, the third in a trilogy for young adults; Cashore questions the distinction between young adult and grown-up literature.

snippet: DRINKING milk is as American as Mom and apple pie. Until not long ago, Americans were encouraged not only by the lobbying group called the American Dairy Association but by parents, doctors and teachers to drink four eight-ounce glasses of milk, '...
abstract: Mark Bittman Op-Ed column questions why Americans are encouraged to drink milk in large quantities, when it has increasingly become clear that many people have difficulty digesting it; suggests for those with heartburn a brief cessation of consuming products that contain dairy. Drawing (M)

headline.main: Got Milk? You Don't Need It

snippet: About the Best Sellers:    These lists are an expanded version of those appearing in the July 8, 2012 print edition of the Book Review, reflecting sales for the week ending June 23, 2012. An asterisk (*) indicates that a book's sales are barely di...

headline.main: Best Sellers: E-Book Nonfiction: Sunday, July 8th 2012

snippet: Yahoo and Facebook agreed on Friday to settle a legal fight over their patent holdings, ending what was shaping up to be one of the nastier court battles in Silicon Valley in recent memory.     Under the terms of the pact, the two companies will e...
abstract: Yahoo and Facebook agree to settle a legal fight over their patent holdings, ending what was shaping up to be a nasty court battle; companies will expand their existing partnership, including a deeper integration of Facebook's tools into Yahoo's content pages. (M)0

headline.main: Yahoo and Facebook Settle A Lawsuit Over Patents

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED
